text.title: Ontario Votes 2007: Interview with Green Party candidate John Ogilvie, Carleton — Mississippi Mills

head.s: Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Green Party candidate John Ogilvie , Carleton — Mississippi Mills

p.s: is running for the Green Party of Ontario in the Ontario provincial election , in the Carleton — Mississippi Mills riding .
' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .

hi.s: Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?

p.s: History is made by those who show up " ( Benjamin Disraeli )

hi.s: What prior political experience do you have ?
What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?

p.s: I have no political experience , but I have built several tech businesses in the past decade and attracted CAD5 million in venture capital to these firms .

hi.s: Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ? Why ?
What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
What would you do to address these issues ?

p.s: The incumbent , Norm Sterling , is a political survivor .
He has been elected eight time for a total of thirty years .
Nobody really knows why .
I am the only businessman and entrepreneur among the candidates , and I have a vision and a plan .
My opponents have their party briefing books .

s.hi: What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?

p.s: Catching up to California on emissions-standards and other pollution/climate measures .
I refuse to have Arnold come up here again and lecture us on how California is leading N. America on environmental issues .

s.hi: Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?

p.s: Local property taxes are rising way too fast for value delivered .

s.hi: How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?

p.s: By helping our local tech community lead the next global tech boom : green-tech .

s.hi: What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ?

p.s: We support it 100 % .
Without it , in the past , our province has lurched hard to the left or to the right with each election , like a car with only two gears , reverse and forward .
MMP would smooth out these destructive swings .

hi.s: What role , if any , does " new media " play in your campaign , and the campaign of your party ?
( websites , blogs , Facebook , YouTube videos , etc ) Do you view it as beneficial , or a challenge ?

p.s: I blog every couple of days , and people seem to enjoy it .
Facebook is a waste of time .
Youtube is good , but it is very time-consuming to produce really good content .

hi.s: Of the decisions made by Ontario 's 38th Legislative Assembly , which was the most beneficial to your this electoral district ?
To the province as a whole ?
Which was least beneficial , or even harmful , to your this riding ?
To the province as a whole ?

p.s: The cancellation of the Labour-Sponsored Investment Fund tax credit , without consultation , put the boot to a recovering tech startup industry .
This was very harmful .
I have been campaigning too long - I ca n't think of anything good to say about the Liberal govt : - )
